speaker: Glacier Pass
lines: Blue ice rises in frozen waves. Crevasses breathe cold like wolves.
Rime crackles beneath your boots; the wind carves knives from the air.
Sunlight prisms through trapped bubbles, turning the world into broken glass rainbows.
Your reflection walks beneath you, stretched long and thin by ages of pressure.
A line of old pitons leads into a snow-choked chute; someone trusted them, once.
Somewhere ahead, a howl warps into something almost like a word.
